alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Madison, northeastern Hancock, northwestern Henry and east central Hamilton Counties through 730 PM EDT ... At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Noblesville to 8 miles northeast of Greenfield. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Anderson around 700 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 210 and 231. Interstate 70 between mile markers 106 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
